Never having played the first game I missed all the hype for the second completely, to find out what all the hype was about I installed this and was dissapointed, regardless of how the first ended or what the sequal promises ill rate this "trailer -demo" for what I found it to be, DULL. I state this because of the speed in which the demo playes out, ive been more captivated by a sand timer! seriously, to captivate and drag in a new audience that may also go ahead full steam to purchase the first??? Nah... didnt do it for me, yall gonna have game fans true and fact, people that lved the first title and are maybe over hyped for a second but for a newbie to the genre - this sucked bug time! Ill give ya'll a good example of how to do it the right way: Assasins creed (Xbox360) picke dup the second game and was hoocked never having played it before or even heard about it, went on after completion to purchase the first and then followed the game for years to nextgen console, I have the stack of physical discs as evidence! (like a library yall) - and thats how its done!  Graphics seemed pretty good but not the best ive seen, there was no user input throughout ( apart from you can turn your head ) and theres nothing more to say, hope ya'll enjoy the game when its released, apparently this is the last piece of software the facebook people will make or promote specifically for the Rift and gen1 Quest because it appears they are throwing the towel in on supporting all us "old gen" CV1 owners (thanks) and with that upsell new hardware or rather forcefeed it when the older tech shouldnt even be an issue because only a very small minority own or have ever used VR and iif you want more people to get in to it give them all the options (not just "here you go" "you need the latest edition at the highest price tag that might last a few years before its worthless"). Anyway.... thats my review, go away now.

one_reviews_text:
Lone Echo is one of my all time top 3 VR games so far, so much better than most other things out there, and actually so excellent, that it is among my favorite all time top games list, no matter if VR or not. 
Such a stellar package of great story, excellent presentation, very good controls and gameplay, very well done locomotion, i could go on and on, just love it.
(While so many aspects are so good, most of all one really feels like having a connection with the other person and experiencing something together, quite an achievement)
Weird i somehow missed this part 2 preview VR experience so long (why don't you recommend it to me Oculus! :) )
Oh yeah, maybe i should also say something about this part 2 preview experience: =)
So of course visually it is again great, the directional 3D sound side very good, too and with its great story presentation wants me to jump into the game right away. I was initially a bit sad that one could not move at all, but makes sense of course regarding the story portion of it.
Overall of course still at worst A+

I have a Rift and am also getting a Quest, so i can play the self contained quick in and out things on the Quest, but games like Lone Echo are why i love also having the Rift, things on this level will just take a few more years until doable in an all self contained device this nicely and i hope Oculus doesn't stop to support getting such awesome things created.
Things like Lone Echo are what makes one not just dream of but really dive fully into an amazing world and show how one can experience things in VR like not possible with any other medium or technology.
Thanks to the creators, you really made something that gives people memories one looks fondly back to for a long time and i'll buy part 2 day one for sure =)

review_title: One of the best AAA VR game is coming!
one_reviews_text:
Graphics are just PERFECT! The first lone echo was very immersive and had one of the best story line of every VR game! Coupled to this exceptional gameplay you can't find elsewhere.

I just hope for a longer game (even if the first was much longer than average title). I also hope the gameplay will be deeper: have like 10% or 5% of the game with fight could be better for me. L.E. is not a shooter but have some extra feature could be better for him to me. The first one only have repair/cut/scan... and even if it's one of the best VR game, this one deserve much!

I will buy it for sure with eyes closed! :)

NB: Please Oculus make AAA title like this one every month! Because to me, yours, are better than every other game on this store. And 2019 will be a 'sad year', only 4 titles from you is coming if i'm right: Defector, Lone Echo 2, Asgard's Wrath and Stormland. VR deserve more AAA game from you!

Of all software available for the Oculus Rift, nothing (so far) even comes close to the must-have system-seller nature and quality of Lone Echo. And there's no reason to believe that Ready at Dawn will not upstage the original in every way in 2019.

From the brief non-interactive demo it is already clear that visual fidelity will be getting an upgrade, with Captain Rhodes hair being animated with real time zero gravity physics and an even more expressive range of facial animation, both elements that will surely apply to whatever new characters players will get to encounter in the sequel. The added character and personality of the cubesats also hints at a finer level of narrative design, because after the theme of the first title having been isolation and loneliness, players are probably about ready to make some new virtual friends on their next adventure.

But the far biggest and most exciting upgrade on the horizon, will surely be Lone Echo 2's combat mechanics, currently going through an unofficial beta test in Echo Combat.

I absolutely cannot wait for this game to launch, because I never spent as much consecutive hours in my Rift as I did playing the original, and sadly that experience has also spoiled me for most other VR games, that still appear to be stuck several generations behind Ready at Dawn's absolute landmark achievement.

See you in 2019 Jack! I hope Olivia can also wait that long...
I played through the first, just can't wait for the seccond, my favorite game is getting a nother part

review_title: Deafie here. Amazing but no subtitles
one_reviews_text:
Amazing demonstration but this has no subtitles.

I'm a deafie software developer, and really need to see software such as these gain subtitles.   As founder of Blur Busters and inventor of TestUFO, I actually had a contract with the Oculus Kickstarter (pre-Facebook) to help them with low-persistence for virtual reality.  But, myself, I am a deafie!

Oculus Store gets docked a star because it does not have a "Subtitles: Yes/No" field like SteamVR does. I heard through a friend that some group at Gallaudet University (deaf university) is considering a lawsuit to Oculus to humbly request Oculus to make a minor change to Oculus Store (a Subtitles Yes/No checkbox) to get them to at least tell deaf gamers whether a VR game has subtitles or not.

BTW, Lone Echo developers, can you please add subtitles to the next version of this software?  Pretty-please?

Ok so i thought it would be a good idea to download it. Well guess what, im mad. It takes me 4 times of RESTARTING the thing and i only get 1 little cut of Olivia fixing the hand. Every other times, its just completly white and gray it it hurts my eyes.
review_feedback: Hey there! Thanks for your feedback and reaching out. If you join the Support Channel in the Echo Games Discord, we'd be happy to look into this issue and try to find a solution.

one_reviews_text: Okay, you can't really do anything, and you won't watch it more than once... or twice, but it's a great trailer, and the quality of the graphics is so great that the immersion seems almost perfect, and it's rendered as real 3D, not a 360-degree-film - it makes you want to touch things because you quickly forget that it's a simulation. Too bad it's so short though, and you cannot walk around or do anything.  Just watch and enjoy, it's worth the download.
couldnt play the first one cos no subtitles and im deaf. please oculus put subtitles on this.

As much as I love my Rift, I rarely anticipate games that aren't out yet. Lone Echo 2 is the exception, and if this short demo is any indication, it is going to be another amazing game.

The visuals (which were already fantastic) seem to have gotten a bit of an upgrade, and the hints of the storyline that we're given are intriguing.

I am truly anxiously waiting for this game to come out!

I'd already heard about Lone Echo, and seen the trailer on You Tube, but not played it. This new edition, with the trailer in VR itself, is really compelling. So much more impressive and convincing than a standard 2D trailer would have been.

I'd not planned to buy the game, but the trailer changed my mind. The voice acting and character models were great, and even within just a few minutes I was dying to find out more about what's going on in the story.

Sign me up!

review_title: Hope this is what I think it is. . . .
one_reviews_text:
OK, I haven't actually tried this yet but if it's what I think it is, a trailer for a VR game that is in itself a fully immersive VR experience you can stand directly inside and look around and stuff in realtime 3D as it's playing, then this is actually something I want to see for almost every VR game/experience going forward. This is the future of game trailers basically, imo, at least in VR.

Edit: Well, the actual "trailer" experience in VR isn't particularly exciting or anything. It's actually quite slow and nothing really happens at all. But, I still absolutely feel this approach to trailers in VR, making them actually be VR themselves, is the future of this kind of thing, especially for game trailers. I just hope that if more companies do it the Oculus adds a clear and seperate "tab" for these VR trailers. Mixing them in among all the other stuff will just fill the store pages up with basically ads.
This is how trailers in VR should be from now on.

review_title: More than a 360 Video or Trailer
one_reviews_text: I would've settled for a teaser trailer, but this is much more.  It's live rendered and has positional tracking in the world, though you can't do anything within it.  It sets up the premise for the second part nicely without spoiling anything and gives you a taste of what's to come: everything you'd expect from a trailer and then some.  Lone Echo fans should absolutely get this and anyone who isn't a Lone Echo fan should absolutely get Lone Echo, play it, and then get this.  Do it now.

review_title: VR Games: 90% Junk. LE is the other 10%
one_reviews_text: I have had my rift for over 3 years now and when comparing the cost of this thing, plus the GPU upgrade I needed at the time, TTL: $1,300, of all the games released for this thing, there are only a handful that are decent. Of that, there are only 3 that are good, and of that 3, only 1 represents what I had always hoped VR would deliver upon. And that's Lone Echo. The fact that they are returning for a second act is what makes this thing worth it and shows VR truly does have a future. I have extremely high hopes for this game and the trailer has got me all excited like a 10-year-old girl at a 1999 nSync concert.

Lone Echo is what got me to buy the Oculus. It is one of the few quality VR titles. Have been looking forward to its follow up.  Wish Oculus would work with the other developers to bring out more quality games like Lone Echo, so I had reason to use my Oculus more.
Liv dies

Nothing that I have played so far has compared to "Lone Echo" for Oculus. The cinematics and interaction in the first game were crisp and well mapped to allow for total immersion. Judging by what I have seen in this non-interactive teaser, Ready At Dawn and Oculus Studios will not disappoint with the release of "Lone Echo II". 

The simplest things like movement of Captain Rhodes' hair suggests an even better experience and an upgrade to the capacity that virtual reality will offer in future. There is a bright future indeed for Oculus, Ready At Dawn, and our favourite protagonists hailing from Kronos II.

Lone Echo is hands-down THE BEST VR game experience on the Rift. And that's dead serious. When can we Pre-Order this next release??? Credit card standing by!
I haven't been this excited about a new game release since... since.. ever! CAN"T WAIT!

After the ending of the first LE, I didn't have much hope for a follow on- for me they blew away the other titles by a wide margin in every area, with an order of magnitude more AAA style content than the others. There's not much else to do for immersive open world gaming once you experience Lone Echo, except Skyrim and Fallout 4 (suggestions are welcome!!). I'm very much looking forward to the release, bring it on!
First

review_title: If the trailer is anything to go by...
one_reviews_text:
then Lone Echo II should be awesome. 

Think I'd best go back and finish the first one though. Don't you just hate it when you get stuck in a particular section never to return. No time like the present I suppose.

*throws money on top of Rift* RELEASE IT ALREADY!

Yes, I know this is just a teaser, and the full game is almost complete, but come on! This is amazing! And the fact that I got to see it render all on it's own is fantastic! 

No pressure, Ready At Dawn. ;)
I loved Lone Echo, the atmospheres, the interactions, the story, the characters. With this trailer I already crave to get back my robotic body, even if it is only a small piece at a time !
It's so nice! Really well made. Must watch, even if you don't play the game, it's just so great.
cant wait to get stuck into this game again  :D
Fantastic, thats how a trailer should be. I loved Lone Echo and can't wait for part 2 - well done. Thanks !
This is gonna be awesome!! Hope they keep pushing the limits of VR!

A clever little taste of a great game to come.
Just exceptional, nothing else to say.

The sequel is going to be awesome - I know it!
